name: Muslim Wellness Foundation
mission: Muslim Wellness Foundation (MWF) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting healing and well-being in American Muslim communities through dialogue, education and training. The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented. From being the first Muslim organization in the country to offer Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings to establishing the annual Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC), MWF has been an outspoken leader in fostering visions for wellness and healing. Our programs demonstrate our keen awareness of the link between oppression, wellness and how communities heal, grow, thrive, and experience joy in the midst of it all. We will continue to lead the way in shifting the conversation on mental health, addiction and trauma - from one narrowly focused on stigma to a healing-centered model of collective well-being, faith, identity and belonging. Join us on this journey.
theoryOfChange: The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented, aiming to shift from stigma-focused models to healing-centered models of collective well-being.

strengths.detail: The organization directs a <cite id="1">100.0% program expense ratio</cite> toward its mission, ensuring no funds are lost to administrative or fundraising overhead.
MWF has achieved a <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 49.6%</cite>, growing from approximately $99,778 in 2021 to <cite id="2">$223,205 in 2023</cite>.
The foundation fills a critical gap by hosting the <cite id="4">Black Muslim Psychology Conference</cite> and providing <cite id="3">Mental Health First Aid trainings</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Muslim Wellness Foundation demonstrates a high level of fiscal discipline regarding its operational costs. According to its <cite id="2">2023 Form 990 filing</cite>, the organization managed to generate <cite id="2">$223,205 in contributions</cite> while maintaining a <cite id="1">fundraising cost of zero dollars</cite>. This lean model allows the foundation to focus entirely on its <cite id="3">capacity-building delivery model</cite>, which prioritizes community education and mental health literacy. The <cite id="2">49.6% revenue growth rate</cite> over the last three years suggests that its message of healing and emotional well-being is resonating strongly with its donor base, allowing for the expansion of its <cite id="4">Black Muslim Psychology Conference</cite> and other equity-focused initiatives.
rich_narrative.summary: Muslim Wellness Foundation (MWF) is a specialized nonprofit organization that addresses the intersection of mental health, racial equity, and spiritual well-being within the American Muslim community. The organization operates with a focused mission to promote community healing through capacity-building initiatives, most notably its <cite id="3">Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings</cite> and the <cite id="4">Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC)</cite>. Despite its relatively small scale, the foundation has demonstrated significant financial momentum, reporting <cite id="2">$223,205 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. This represents a robust <cite id="2">three-year revenue CAGR of 49.6%</cite>, indicating a rapid growth phase as it expands its reach in the global health and wellness sector. MWF distinguishes itself by maintaining a <cite id="1">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that every dollar of functional expense is directed toward its core programming. Furthermore, the organization operates with exceptional lean efficiency, reporting a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. While the foundation provides critical niche services, it currently operates with <cite id="1">0.2 months of working capital</cite>, suggesting a high reliance on consistent, ongoing donor support to maintain its specialized community interventions.
